website_summaries.verdict: Repashy's grub pie mix should appeal to many reptile species, with a multivitamin "superfood" approach.
pros: Contains a healthy blend of insect protein and vegetable sources
Can be formed into a paste, slurry, or gel
Fortified with essential vitamins, minerals, and nutrients
cons: Recommended jellied preparation can be messy
Some reptiles not attracted to mix

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, Tasty, Easier to make than Jello Jigglers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Excellent ingredients, only mix what you intend to use and save the rest of the powder for later. My Axolotl was on an eating strike. This helped get him eating again. Next time I will try the Meat Variety. My daughter poured these into a Hello Kitty Candy Mold before freezing them. You can have fun with them if you want to.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Takes patience to get them to accept new food
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little work to get dragon to take. I use mini ice tray for mold . Slice it into thin slices and hand feed him with his favorite bug. Eventually he'll mistake gel for bug and start to eat it. only started last week Hope to get him down to half of live bugs. Update: after two weeks, I no longer have to trick him to get him to eat cubes. Now he turns his head at any live bugs with the exception of roaches. He used to go crazy over horn worms and super worms, not any more, just eats these cubes. Wish I had known that b4 I had all these live bugs shipped to me.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to feeders for a finicky bearded dragon
customer_reviews.text: My year old bearded dragon hasn't been eating so I purchase this as an alternative food source and although she was hesitant at first and I had to help her taste it she actually started to enjoy it. I noticed her energy has increased and her mood has changed... thank you we're giving me away to feed a stubborn bearded dragon! The only drawback is the color because bearded dragons are enticed by certain colors when it comes to food and this is definitely not one of those colors.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Bearded dragon likes it but only fresh out of the oven
customer_reviews.text: The grub pie is easy to make and makes quite a bit. The directions say that it will stay good in the fridge for up to two weeks so I made some and bagged it for the fridge. I was hoping to be able to use this when I go on vacation for my pet sitter in place of bugs. My dragon really enjoyed the grub pie when it was warm and fresh but once it was refrigerated, he would not eat it at all. I still have half a bottle, so I plan to try to make it again and warm it up for him each serving. I am hoping that helps, because it is a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's like having your cake and eating it too for Beardies, they love it
customer_reviews.text: Every bearded dragon is different. Some can even become picky eaters. When my (2) bearded dragons were young (juveniles) they didn't care for this stuff. They'd eat it, but didn't seem "crazy" for it. Wow, have things changed. They absolutely go crazy for this stuff now! (Still juveniles) I don't know what it is, but they have acquired a taste for it and prefer it over dubia roaches. Maybe because I make it with LOVE.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Quinonez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and versatile food
customer_reviews.text: I’m a big fan and long-time user of Allen Repashy’s line of foods and supplements, and this is one of the formulas I use the most. I really like the fact that I am able to use the Grub Pie for such a variety of different animals. It works for everything from monitors to skinks to bearded dragons, axolotls, fish, and tadpoles. Also makes a good mix in to powdered gecko diets for a protein boost. You can also mix with water to make a slurry for syringe feeding any reptiles that need a nutritional boost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great to supplement water intake + variety.
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon loves this. For a human, the scent created when you combine the mix and boiling water is gag-inducing, but it sends my beardie into a frenzy. He gobbles this up. My turtle enjoys a piece on occasion too. What's nice is you can modify your mixture to be more or less watery depending on your need, spanning from milkshake consistency to be fed by syringe if the animal is ill, to a wobbly gelatin (my beardie's favorite), to more fudge-like. This works best as a treat. At least in my beardie, it results in very smelly poops if he has too much.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: My Bearded Dragon LOVES his Grub Pie!
customer_reviews.text: My beardie loves him some grub pie! He gets excited when he smells or sees me with it. Wish he got so excited for all his vegis. The mix portions seem slightly off as I have to add way less water than recommended unless he wants to drink it like a soup. It does set up quite fast (like as soon as it begins to cool) but I have learned to mix quick and I make small batches at a time
customer_reviews.author: AShields

customer_reviews.title: My lizards wont touch it
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Giant Cuban Anoles that will eat almost anything, but they wont touch this. When mixed with water according to the directions, it forms a very firm gelatinous lump, which the lizards dont like. Is it a questions of training them to eat it? I dont know, but they will not take it if offered on tongs~
customer_reviews.author: Hozer

customer_reviews.title: Believe the positive reviews - My bearded dragon loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Buy it. Mix with a little hot water. Wait a few minutes to set up. Watch fingers as you give a piece to dragon. My bearded dragon can be very picky, loving crickets and hornworms, but those can add up in price or are a pain. Good list of ingredients, so I can be confident in feeding this, along with greens and berries. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: WineFolk

customer_reviews.title: My Axolotls love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is quite simple to use ....just boiling water and mix. I don't have a worm mold so I just pour in on waxed paper, let it cool and cut it up into long strips. You can refrigerate the leftovers or just make what you need. My axolotls love this stuff as well as my sons sea turtle.
customer_reviews.author: kim vogel

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an alternative food source for my critters. My Chameleons, Tiger Salamanders, White's Treefrogs, Leopard Gecko and Musk Turtles are enjoying it. While live insects are the best option. I would like to get my animals accustomed to an emergency food source I can have a stash of.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Dahlin

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Usually Repashy is awesome and I read such great reviews I had to try it. My dragon hates it, won’t eat it, it smells awful, and it doesn’t expand to make a good amount, so overall it wasn’t a good purchase for me particularly. It still has good nutrition and other herp owners may have good luck with it but I’ll probably end up dumping it into my dubia colony.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Grub pie is well worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased how quickly my dragons took to eating the grub pie. Before this they both were very well fed with dubias, large super worms and horn worms. I wasn’t sure how they would adjust to the pie but they both grew a fair amount shedding twice in about 3 weeks. Another plus with grub pie has a quick prep time and when it’s feeding time you simply cut a slice and feed. EASY AS PIE!!! No worrying about gut loading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My picky leo loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My leo is a really picky eater, wont touch crickets, dubai roaches, mealworms, hornworms. Ive been trying for months to figure out what he'll eat. I heard about grub pie last week and immediately ordered. I have to say i am so happy that my leo likes it! He ate off tongs for the first time in probably over a year! My silly boy kept licking his lips after eating this!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: The Bearded Dragons loved it.
customer_reviews.text: The product was very easy to use. Mixing it up was similar to mixing up instant pudding. We used it with some catipilar silicone molds we bought. The dragons really loved them. Thebproduct stayed good in the bbn fridge for about 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Aeternus

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy purchase here
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love using this product for all of my Geckos, however the one I received from here didn’t work out. The one I got was expired/seal broke & was a hard clumpy mess, not as it should be
customer_reviews.author: Brandon J Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: It smells horrible and my beardie didn’t like it
customer_reviews.text: I'm rating it 3 stars because it did come as described, and I understand that other people's pets may have enjoyed it. I got it so I could add a bit to his salads to make them more appealing to him. Jaxon, my beardie, recoiled from it as soon as I tried to feed it to him. He's not very picky, but this stuff made him flinch. It smelled a lot worse than I expected it to smell. Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Donie

customer_reviews.title: Repashy is a life saver
customer_reviews.text: Pur Savannah monitor and our leopard geckos love this stuff! It doesnt seem like you get slow but it makes alot. The only down side for us is one of our leopard geckos wont eat this from a bowl, so we have to tong feed him it.
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My Axolotl and my fish love this stuff. It so easy to make. I only need one tbs for two weeks. This food is so good for them. It is my Axolotl’s main food
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: beardie absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.text: i dont give this to her all the time she usually has fresh veggies and live foods but she absolutely loves this stuff when i do give it to her.
customer_reviews.author: Zepherea

customer_reviews.title: expensive
customer_reviews.text: Found cheaper in a petstore - but my bearded dragon loves it - used for after burmation - needs more after then it says. but it’s fresh and good to go
customer_reviews.author: Higgins Crew Master

customer_reviews.title: Beardie LOVES this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon really really really likes this stuff, maybe too much. I put little chunks in a feeding bowl and I've never seen her so aggressively attack her food before. Super easy to make batches of this stuff and it smells kinda awful but as long as she's happy, I'll endure!
customer_reviews.author: Katey B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to make but our fire skink doesn't seem to like it!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried it jello-style in little cubes and like more of a congealed paste, but he doesn't take it at all. Too bad because it's very easy to make and keep.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Parker

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Insect filler YOU WILL FEED your lizards!!
customer_reviews.text: I think the most important thing is that all my bearded dragons and crested geckos and leopard geckos all go CRAZY FOR THIS STUFF!!! NO JOKE!!! They attack the feeder tweezers to get to it! Amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Leopard geckos aren’t really fans
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my leopard geckos because they weren’t eating. I will say they have all tried it, but most of the time they refuse to eat it. Of course that’s their fault- not the products. They are just brats.
customer_reviews.author: mandapantsreads

customer_reviews.title: My little guy won't eat it.
customer_reviews.text: my leopard gecko won't eat it, which is sad because I love love love repashy.
customer_reviews.author: Tuesday

customer_reviews.title: Puff Likes It
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to make or to mix with vegetables for a more balanced diet for bearded dragons who love bugs but don't like vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: Lorne Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Bearded dragon approved.
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old bearded dragon has no problems eating the grub pie and it is easy to make.
customer_reviews.author: Evil Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Beardie’s fav
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to make. Doesn’t smell too terrible. My picky beardie gobbles it up.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my bearded dragon doesn't seem to like it very much but he will eat it if insects are not offered
customer_reviews.author: Smiley face

customer_reviews.title: Great food!
customer_reviews.text: We love giving this to our bearded dragon and leopard geckos as a treat to change things up from their norm, they all go bonkers for it every time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Slavin

customer_reviews.title: My 3 leopard geckos love it
customer_reviews.text: When I bought grub pie, I was skeptical about my leopard geckos eating something that didn’t move on it’s own. However, they took it immediately after smelling it. Happy to have this to offer if I can’t get insects right away.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Haslett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for insectivore reptiles
customer_reviews.text: This aided with gaining weight for my female geckos when they went on heat and for those picky eaters, too.
customer_reviews.author: M.K. Mischo

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and it last a good while. My dragons and dubias love it
customer_reviews.author: Edna

customer_reviews.title: He loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Kevin loves his grub pie and I love not handling cockroaches!
customer_reviews.author: A. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Finicky dragon no more!
customer_reviews.text: Finally something that my finicky dragon loves. She gobbled it up after one sniff. Easy to make and does not leave a mess. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BunnyCruz

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This product saved our gecko's life. He wasn't eating was dying due to him not being able to see. Read about this product give it a try, took a lil bit of time to get him to try slowly he began to eat. Now he is healthy & back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Lokii92

customer_reviews.title: Axolotls love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE Repashy and so do my axolotls!! The best ingredients out there! They keep their frills and skin looking nice! I tell everyone to get Repashy! P. S my one axolotl is VERY picky and loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Leeah

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt take long to make and my b.dragon loves it.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great. My 5 month bearded dragon loves it. takes a sec for him to sniff it and he chases me for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Villa

customer_reviews.title: My bearded dragon LOVES this!!
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragon LOVES this! He’s so healthy and big, and no nasty live insects! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pikachu

customer_reviews.title: Product is exactly what ordered
customer_reviews.text: My leopard gecko was refusing food and I read this would jumpstart her appetite
customer_reviews.author: Mikaela Rush

customer_reviews.title: Great back up if needed.
customer_reviews.text: Bearded dragon, draco. Went straight to it and eats it like crack. Works for me cause he doesn't like crickets. But give it as a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My geckos don't really like it but I use it to cut load feeders!
customer_reviews.author: kmc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing full diet for insect eating reptiles
customer_reviews.text: I have several reptiles I use this with. My bearded dragon LOVES this stuff making it very easy for friends to feed while I am away (they have a fear of bugs). My leopard geckos took some time to take to but again love it. Even my crestie LOVES this as a super special treat. I recommend to anyone wanting a simple way to feed their reptiles.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: the smell is horrible. My dragon would not eat it directly
customer_reviews.text: I made this into the gel, the smell is horrible. My dragon would not eat it directly. I did feed to the feeder insects, and he ate them. So, we are all happy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kirk

customer_reviews.title: not appealing to my Bearded Dragons
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 Bearded dragons and none of the will eat this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very easy to make and stores for a good
customer_reviews.text: goes a long way if you own only one reptile, very easy to make and stores for a good while
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative
customer_reviews.text: easy to make and prevents me from having to keep feeders on hand at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He didn't eat it
customer_reviews.text: This is some smelly stuff. My beardie did not go near it.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Jo

customer_reviews.title: Chinese water dragon?
customer_reviews.text: Can I feed this to my Chinese water dragon too?
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: very fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: My bearded dragons won't eat it...but it's just because they are spoiled with fresh and live food. Was very quick to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Brittani

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It arrived earlier than expected and both my beardies like it when I can't get roaches
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great stuff! My beardie, and other various insect eating reptiles devour it! Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Axolotls love it
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out, you MUST bring the water to a complete high boil for the jello like texture to be successful, I make a batch every week and feed it every other day to my Axolotls. Who also get earthworms daily. They love this stuff
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie Dale

customer_reviews.title: My dragons love it
customer_reviews.text: My dragons love it and it very easy for me help get my dragons interested in the salad I make each day for them
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Koonce

product_meta.title: Repashy Grub Pie Insectivore Diet Gel Premix (Reptile) 6 Oz JAR
product_meta.description: DIRECTIONS: Bring water to a boil on stove, in microwave or kettle. Pour boiling water into a bowl and immediately stir in powder (1 part powder to 2-3 parts water). Let cool or immediately pour into mold. Gel sets at room temperature. Cut into pieces or strips for feeding. Once made, gel should be treated as fresh food and can be sealed and stored in refrigerator for up to two weeks, or frozen.
feature_bullets: Our Insect Based (75%) Meal Replacement Paste/Gel. A complete diet that can be used as a staple for Insectivores or a treat for omnivores like Sugar Gliders . Insects are raised in the USA on a high-quality diet!
Guaranteed Analysis: Crude Protein min. 40%, Crude Fat min. 12%, Crude Fiber max. 15%, Moisture max. 10%, Ash max. 12%, Calcium min. 1.4%.
